intro: Stenogyne macrantha var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
